content: spendigo 2024 © sandra levey 2024 the australian sheep and wool show is held in bendigo victoria during july of each year avid crafters know it by the nickname spendigo due to the vast amount of shopping that takes place by the thousands of attendees at the 3 day event i usually try to make something new to wear each year and had intended to write up the pattern for my last attendance but life got in the way so with some tweaks i have now produced this simple one size fits most snug-fitting beanie both yarns in the sample shown were produced by the local bendigo woollen mills bwm why only one size well it s a free pattern and i always begin with a design i wish to make for myself so if you happen to be the same size that s great you re a knitter - i m sure that you ll decide what needs altering to suit your needs want a slouchy add a few more rounds the thought of corrugated ribbing makes you feel ill use one colour don t understand why i work a knit round after cast-on and before commencing ribbing i detest seeing purl bumps in another colour if it doesn t bother you just go ahead with the ribbing size one size only to fit 54cm 21 head yarn colour a bwm classic 8 ply - though sample used 45 metres of barka diplomata which i believe was previously produced by bwm colour b bwm classic 8 ply - sample used 72 metres in claret mix colour discontinued gauge 24 sts and 26 rounds to 10cm measured over colourwork needles 3 5mm 40cm 16 circular for brim 4 00mm 40cm 16 circular for remainder dpn s for crown notions one stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends skills corrugated two colour ribbing stranded colourwork knit from a chart purl 2 decrease knit 2 decrease abbreviations sts stitches k1p1 knit 1 purl 1 k2tog knit 2 together p2tog purl 2 together notes bear in mind any alteration you make to the stitch count to accommodate a different size must work with the chart as well as the numbers when commencing the crown decreases chart is in multiples of 8 sts while the crown begins with multiples of 13 13 x 8 = 104sts the pinwheel-style crown alternates between knit and purl sections if you prefer a smooth crown simply substitute the purl stitches for knit instead spendigo 2024 ©sandra levey july 2024 pattern using 3 5mm needle and colour a co 104 sts place a stitch marker and join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches knit one round alternating between colour b for knit sts and colour a for purl work a k1p1 ribbing until work measures 3 5cm from cast on edge change to 4 00mm needle and commence working from the coloured chart on page 3 an additional greyscale chart is provided for you
